intro: Mimusops fragans, commonly known as the fragrant star apple, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and showy, fragrant yellow flowers. The tree produces edible fruits that are typically spherical and have a smooth, yellowish skin. The fruit contains a sweet, white, creamy pulp surrounded by a single large seed. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and as a source of food in tropical regions.
